intro: Zala asiatica, commonly known as the Asian zala, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks. Its aromatic foliage and delicate white or yellow flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
